title: Learning team: 2016 Vision
body: The overall goal of the learning team is to spread a message of openness far and wide. This is achieved by building a strong network backed with evidence and resources to enable everyone to learn about open data.

title: Goals
body:
The overall goal of the learning team is to spread a message of openness far and wide. This is achieved by building a strong network backed with evidence and resources to enable everyone to learn about open data.

This can be split down into five key goals.
instruction: Click the forward arrow for more.Select the ‘+’ sign to explore further, then swipe the image to see more.

_items.title: 1) Increase reach
_items.body:
In addition to new face-to-face courses, the learning team will launch online learning.

Putting short modules online will instantly increase reach, drive conversion of face-to-face courses and enable wider engagement though online as well as face-to-face follow up, i.e. webinars.

_items.title: 2) Build network
_items.body:
Increase the size of the trainer network to help reach more people face to face

2016 sees the introduction of ODI Learning Associates which will recongnise those who inspire and lead open data activities around the world.

This is in addition to adding a new cohort of registered trainers who enable anyone to gain new knowledge in open data

_items.title: 3) Create inspiring content
_items.body:
Create inspiring, world leading content for delivery via online, public and in-house training products

In addition we will be adding Training Packs to online courses (availble via the menu in the top right) that give people additional resources that will help deliver face-to-face sessions related to each training module.

Our registered trainers can use these to build new ODI courses. Associates are free to access, use and share this content.

_items.title: 4) Streamline delivery
_items.body:
Will will be stramlining the delivery of content via the new ODI ODI Learning Management System. You are using this system right now!

This system will support peoples engagement with ODI Learning, both in face-to-face courses and through their online learning, even offline via mobile apps.

This system will be the point of communication through which people can learn, book training, access materials and engage with networking events.

_items.title: 5) Actively engage network
_items.body:
In 2016 we are targetting our network to develop new courses and content for the Learning Management System and eLearning platform.

We will introduce a fast track programme for select registered trainers to enable them to get their own courses into the eLeanring platform and to as many people as possible.

We will also actively support the network with resources available via the new Trainer Packs

title: 3 stages of engagement
body:
Increasing reach and content delivery will be focussed through a three stage pipeline.

This pipeline will be backed with a new Skills framework which details compentances for beginners, practicioners and experts in open data skills.
instruction: The three stages of engagemnet are briefly described below.

_items.title: Face-to-face training
_items.body:
Delivered via face-to-face and in-hourse courses. Face-to-face training is key to building lasting relationships with learners.

Amoung other courses, in 2016 we will add new courses focussing on business models, aggriculture and the environment as well as expnding our public data science courses.

We shall also be revamping the Open Data in Practice, Law and licensing and finding stories courses with the help of our network.

We shall also be working with the network to introduce a number of new courses not owned by ODIHQ.

_items.title: Anytime learning
_items.body:
2016 will see the launch of not only the online learning platform, but also mobile learning. Mobile learning will enable everyone in all countries to engagement meaningfully with the educational materials produced by the ODI.

All courses produced via this Learning Management System can be quickly and effectively dilivered for offline learning and consumption on planes, trains and in less well connected countries.

All courses and sessions created both internally and by the network will have associated anytime learning modules.

_items.title: Focussed engagements
_items.body:
Following learning, the team will be increasing its offer of innovation workshops to include member webinars and expert panels.

Such events will provide value to the network and offer a sense of connection to the ODI.

Online events will be advertised through the anytime learning platforms built in machanism.

title: Enterprise training products
body:
Shifting to the anytime learning space will allow the delelopment and delivery of enterprise scale learning.

For enterprises this will mean focussed training can be delivered to thousands of staff, quickly and eaxily.
instruction: Click the headings below to find out more.

_items.title: Customised learning
_items.body:
In addition to a standard public facing product, anytime learning can be customised to suit the needs of a customer.

A large portfolio of modules can be combined to build a unique product. In addition new modules can be easily added which provide key messages relavent to each customer.

Finally, each product can be white boxed and delivered in customer branding, thus meeting an internal training need of that organisation

_items.title: Enterprise delivery
_items.body:
To reach everyone, custom delivered anytime eLearning will be delivered as enterprise products.

This will mean that distribution, support and and monitoring can be combined into one product for delivery via organisation enterprise programmes. This prodives a one click mechanism to engage thousands of people.

_items.title: Professional analytics
_items.body:
Full breakdown of user engagement on a per module and course basis will detail completion, time taken, pass rates and user behavior.

The analytics dashboard will allow senior executives to quickly view programme results, effectivness and reach.

This will allow workforces to train quickly and effectively in open data.

title: Innovative projects
body:
2016 will see a growth in the learning team project portfolio

Projects provide focus on innovation, new ciricular and modes of delivery.

Projects link all aspects of the three stage pipeline together and allow us to deliver more effetively and be agile to future change.
